page.title: 01HISTORY OF WYCHWOOD FOREST
page.content: A large area of this block is covered by {privately owned parkland} surrounding{CORNBURY HOUSE .}Most ofthe remainder is the ancient {FOREST {OF WYCHWOOD.}The village of {Finstock lies on the S.E. corner,and the small market town of {Charlbury} borders the N.E. corner. {William I }took possession of {Wychwood Forest }in {1086, }and Rainald was the keeper,paying Â£10 a year to the king. It remained a { {Royal Hunting Forest}and valuable source of {timber}until the {Act of {Enclosure}in 1857,when it passed to the {owner}of {Cornbury Park.}About two_thirds of the forest was cut down at that time.
